docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 21 -- The Security Council sweepingly rejected today a Soviet resolution that would have condemned United States action in the Dominican Republic and would have called for an immediate withdrawal of foreign troops.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 21 -- The Security Council sweepingly rejected today a Soviet resolution that would have condemned United States action in the Dominican Republic and would have called for an immediate withdrawal of foreign troops.
docs.abstract: Security Council rejects USSR motion to condemn US and call for immediate withdrawal; USSR had demanded vote; charged Council awaited Imbert actions; Mayobre repts truce generally effective

headline.main: SOVIET REBUFFED BY U.N. COUNCIL; Resolution to Condemn Role of U.S. in the Dominican Republic Is Rejected SOVIET REBUFFED BY U.N. COUNCIL

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWERSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: " The Marines were to be neutral in the Dominican Republic, but were at first 'neutral' on the side of the junta, and then on the side of the rebels, and then back again to the junta until a new order of 'strict neutrality' went out."
docs.lead_paragraph: " The Marines were to be neutral in the Dominican Republic, but were at first 'neutral' on the side of the junta, and then on the side of the rebels, and then back again to the junta until a new order of 'strict neutrality' went out."

docs.snippet: CAN we depend on the Organization of American States to check Communist take-overs in Latin America? Or are we going to have to do the job ourselves, intervening unilaterally?
docs.lead_paragraph: CAN we depend on the Organization of American States to check Communist take-overs in Latin America? Or are we going to have to do the job ourselves, intervening unilaterally?
docs.abstract: J P Davies Jr article holds US intervention succeeded in stopping physical expansion of revolt but broadened popular Dominican support and may have expanded Communist base; illus; says US cannot depend on OAS for immediate mil action in Communist flare-ups

docs.abstract: Security Council approves French resolution calling for permanent cease-fire by all sides; US abstains; Stevenson implies US could impose truce; notes US forces stand between rebels and junta; debate detailed; UN-OAS contest seen major issue; USSR and France object to leading OAS role

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 27 -- A series of banking scandals here led yesterday to the appointment of a three-man commission to run the Government's National Bank of the Republic. It will replace the bank's present board of directors.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 29 -- The Johnson Administration is facing a series of dilemmas in the Dominican Republic that are partly of its own making and that officials believe can be resolved only with time and a period of peace.
